review_text: It's a great place for kids to play and it has multiple grills.
Nice park, they need a splash pad for little ones n elders.
Nice play ground , pool, basketball, tennis, baseball field and walking trails we loved it.
Fun hiking, Robert Frost trail at this section is easy only a few ups and downs, can be a little damp.
Memorial Day 2020. Mill River park grills and tables are already set perfectly for social distancing. It was nice to set under big tree canopy alongside river stream.
I have a 10 year old baseball player, so I spend a lot of time there. Very laid back rec area. Dogs are welcome, which is great.  Everyone seems to respect each other.

We went for our Church outing.  Nice place, had areas for cooking out, walking, and playing different games.  Near the pool were basketball courts, and a playground for young children.  Lots of people were there with dogs.

What great food and service.The beer was large and cold.  I really enjoyed the atmosphere. The decor was colorful, like being in a Mexican Villa. I loved the large Gothic Arches that separated the seating space. One couldn't ask for better service. The server was attentive and friendly. I will make this one of my go to places when I return.

I grew up on the Mill River. It was basically in my backyard. I feel blessed for that. Everyone walks there dogs down there. I take Charlie  there everyday. It's a beautiful place where community and dogs come together to all get along.

Place this resoundingly in the plus column for Northampton's "livability". It's a beautiful place and residents take advantage of the trails year 'round. Many locals also refer to it as "the dog park" because it's a great place to let your (trained and properly socialized) furbaby run, sniff, play, swim. It's great for walking/hiking/running and is a favorite local swimming spot. There's an exquisitely rough (unpaved, pothole-riddled, often muddy) parking area shared by the community gardens. Definitely *not* wheelchair friendly. No trash receptacles are provided, so plan to carry out with you any trash you generate. There have been problems with folks not cleaning up after their dogs and the problem threatens to ruin the place or restrict dogs, so don't be part of the problem; carry a baggie if you come with a dog.
Beautiful walk and swim
This is a great walk along the river between Smith College and Federal Street.
Neighborly trail for hiking, running, wading

This area is gorgeous. We saw a great blue Heron (sorry the pic quality is not great), and it was HUGE.

Our dog loves it here, and the paths are all extremely well curated. It is apparent a lot of love and attention goes into making this place a great community spot. We went on a Saturday in the early afternoon and it was clearly a well loved spot by locals bringing their kids and pets.
Exquisite beautiful day. Enjoyed being able to take in the fall foliage, despite using a walker, along the accessible trail. Thank you for the access!

What an enchanting forest. I loved the babbling brook that ran alongside the trail. The terrain was flat for easy walking just look out for tree roots. No there were no mosquitoes,  just  birds chirping.
Very nice but people need to be more considerate, they left a lot of garbage behind and I don't get why bc this place has garbage bins. It's nice let's keep it that way
If you like the clearest of waters, these seem to do some standing and can smell a little and have bird poo floating on the surface. It's not the hugest, but it's definitely longer than a 25yd pool.
Relatively secluded, full of interesting flora and fauna, as well as a small brook and a tiny waterfall. I spotted turtles and water snakes! Good for taking long walks.

I'm in my early sixties now and my first Adventure at the Mill Rivers Conservation Area I was all of three years old I've grown up in the area I've enjoyed having that area to have adventures in meet people playing things go fishing or swimming quiet places to walk and talk I've been experiencing all that for 58 years there
Wonderfully named BridgeThe go place. However, spring clean up us needed. Beer cans arounrd the entrance. Didn't actually walk in. Bus device has become unpredictable.

Great quiet walking trail. Be warned this side of the river is NOT for dogs off leash. The trail traverses private land . The great Northampton dog park is on the other side of the river with access from Burt's Pit Rd
Great place to walk dogs or just walk in general. Great place to meet others from the community!
Very nice pool and I love how they have lap swim. The locker rooms are old and not very comfortable but it's not too bad.
Fun spot to swim and play in the pool! They have lifeguards at all times
Kiddy pool closes at 12 daily so I guess kids don't swim after 12. Sprinkler Park is closed guess we will go to Northampton .

They will be opening on the 27th. Its $4 a day l believe and you can buy a season pass there at the pool.
Watch this space for a report when it's open.
You must arrive in you costume (bathing suit) and social distance.
You must wear masks, except in the pool.
So, the first day of opening l had the pool to my self as it was raining.
it is opens at 10 to 1pm for lap swimming  then it's open swim. Til 730 M-F
Weekends 11 to 1pm lap then open till 6pm.
.
Really great lifeguards and you can use  kick boards and hand  floats which they provide.
very beautiful with lots of hidden gems
Great place to go during scorching heat. Plenty of lifeguards on duty. Clean pool with various depths. Kiddie pool also available. Plenty of  parking. Something for everyone.
With everything that's going on it's still a good safe place for my son to have fun  and burn energy

For parents: there is a toddler pool in it's own fenced enclosure that is FREE and has no schedule like the big pool. You don't even need to go through the locker room. It's 2' deep and there's a spray tower. I wish this was more clear from the website since I thought I had to wait for afternoon free swim. Learned my lesson!

It's a nice, small, local river that quite a few people frequent during the warm weather months down stream. In the spring, you will see several fishermen traversing the stream for trout fishing, either fly fishing or with salmon eggs. It can be quite relaxing just strolling by the stream as well. Be aware, the stream does go by and through private property at times, please be respectful and don't walk on or trash their property. You bring it in, you take it out
The snowmobile bridges are a little rickety but we always have a blast in the winter. It would be cool if things were weed whacked in the summer but I understand that's hard to keep up.
Happy holidays
